explanations.machine learning: The paper proposes data-driven approaches to model nonlinear wave loads using machine learning techniques.
explanations.unsupervised learning: The K-means algorithm, an unsupervised clustering technique, is used to classify the CFD data into clusters.
explanations.clustering: The K-means algorithm is used to cluster the CFD data to optimize the dataset for training the ML models.
explanations.neural network: The paper mentions the use of LSTM, which is a type of neural network, for predicting nonlinear wave loads.
explanations.deep learning: The use of LSTM indicates the application of deep learning techniques in the study.
explanations.long short-term memory: An LSTM predictor is used to estimate the residual between the linear model and CFD results.
explanations.LSTM: An LSTM predictor is implemented as part of the hybrid approach for predicting nonlinear wave loads in the time domain.
